contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox anthem |title = Kongesangen |english_title = Song of the King |image = Harald V Norge.jpg |caption = Harald V |prefix = Royal |country = {{NOR}} |composer = |music_date = |author = [[Henrik Wergeland]] & [[Gustav Jensen]] |lyrics_date = |adopted = 1906 |until |sound = |sound_title = }} '''''Kongesangen''''' (''Song of the King'') is [[Norway]]'s [[Royal anthem]]. The lyrics come in several versions. The first version (''Gud signe kongen vor'') was written by [[Henrik Wergeland]], but the version used today and quoted below was written by [[Gustav Jensen]] for the [[coronation]] of King [[Haakon VII]] in 1906. It was inspired by the British Royal and National anthem, and set to the same tune as "[[God Save the Queen]]". {|style=wikitable |- | ==Lyrics== '''1''' :''Gud sign vår konge god!'' :''Sign ham med kraft og mod'' :''sign hjem og slott!'' :''Lys for ham ved din Ånd,'' :''knytt med din sterke hånd'' :''hellige troskapsbånd'' :''om folk og drott! '''2''' :''Høyt sverger Norges mann'' :''hver i sitt kall, sin stand,'' :''troskap sin drott.'' :''Trofast i liv og død,'' :''tapper i krig og nød,'' :''alltid vårt Norge lød'' :''Gud og sin drott.'' || ==Translation{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}}== '''1''' :God bless our gracious king! :Bless him with strength and courage, :bless home and castle! :Guide him with Your [[Holy Spirit|Spirit]], :tie with Your strong Hand :holy bands of allegiance :around people and sovereign! '''2''' :Loudly swear men of Norway :each in his calling, his station, :loyalty to the sovereign. :Loyal in life and death, :courageous in war and need, :always our Norway obeyed :God and its sovereign. |} {{National anthems of Norway}} [[Category:National symbols of Norway]] [[Category:Norwegian monarchy]] [[Category:Norwegian songs]] [[Category:Royal anthems]]
